thread.title: Morning Sports Update: Brandon Marshall tweets he ‘should be walking back to New York’ - Sports
thread.title_full: Morning Sports Update: Brandon Marshall tweets he ‘should be walking back to New York’ - Sports

author: boston.com
title: Morning Sports Update: Brandon Marshall tweets he ‘should be walking back to New York’ - Sports
text:
Brandon Marshall tweets frustration following the Jets’ loss to the Patriots. Brandon LaFell is also critical of his own performance, and Danny Ainge expresses sadness after the death of Flip Saunders.
Brandon Marshall tweets he deserves to walk back to New York after losing to Patriots:
My A** should be walking back to New York. How you bounce back after moments like this produce CHAMPIONS or CHUMPS.. . #jets
— Machine Marshall (@BMarshall) October 25, 2015 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Brandon LaFell gives himself an ‘F’ against Jets: “Brandon LaFell isn’t his harshest critic, but he’s pretty close. In the Patriots’ 30-23 win over the Jets on Sunday, LaFell finished the game with two catches, 25 yards, and six of New England’s 11 drops, via the AP.” ( Boston.com )
The three plays the Patriots used to beat the Jets: “Tom Brady did it in three plays. He found that little string – the thread that was keeping the New York Jets defense together – and he pulled it. Three plays that didn’t go exactly as planned, but unspooled the opposition anyway. This is why the New England Patriots still own the AFC East.” ( Yahoo! )
Rob Gronkowski upends Jets’ gameplan: “Another meeting with Rob Gronkowski, another beatdown by the Patriots’ man-mountain tight end.” ( New York Post )
Danny Ainge ‘deeply saddened’ by death of Timberwolves’ Flip Saunders: “I am deeply saddened by the loss of Flip Saunders,” Ainge said. “Flip dedicated so much of his life to basketball and the NBA. His life has impacted so many. May God bless his wife Debbie, their children, and extended family. He will be missed greatly by our small NBA community.” ( NESN.com )
Revolution clinch playoff spot with 3-1 win over New York City FC: “Charlie Davies had a goal and an assist and the New England Revolution clinched a playoff spot with a 3-1 victory over New York City FC on Sunday.” ( Boston.com )
Jets quarterback Ryan Fitzpatrick exploits Malcolm Butler: “Nobody’s afraid of Malcolm Butler. Nor should they be.” ( CSNNE.com )
Photo finish: Fantastic images from Jets vs. Patriots
 The Patriots take on the Jets, in photos. Charles Krupa / AP Denis Doyon, left, of Bristol, Rhode Island; Blake Chichester, center, of Hampton, New Hampshire; and Michael Pouliotte, right, of Berwick, Maine, unite for a tailgate Sunday before the New England Patriots’ rivalry matchup against the New York Jets. Steven Senne / AP Selfie stick. Charles Krupa / AP “Let’s party.” Charles Krupa / AP Re-enactors known as the End Zone Militia arrive outside Gillette Stadium. Charles Krupa / AP Pierce Dunn, of Olive Branch, Mississippi, throws a football in the parking lot before kickoff. Charles Krupa / AP Tom Brady runs onto the field during warm-ups. Jim Rogash / Getty Images Rob Gronkowski greets the End Zone Militia. Jim Rogash / Getty Images Star cornerback Darrelle Revis returns to Foxboro for the first time since last season, when he was wearing Patriots colors. Jim Rogash / Getty Images Bruce Saperstein, left, of Brookyln, New York, and Brian Minch of Burlington, Massachusetts wear their respective Revis jerseys before the game. Revis played in New York from 2007-2012, before signing with the Patriots for one season in 2014. Matthew J. Lee / The Boston Globe Quarterback Ryan Fitzpatrick fumbles as New England Patriots defensive end Chandler Jones gives chase during the Jets’ first possession. Charles Krupa / AP Malcolm Butler breaks up a pass intended for the Jets’ Eric Decker. Jim Davis / The Boston Globe Jeremy Kerley catches a touchdown pass on a goal-line slant play. Charles Krupa / AP Brady dives over the offensive line for a touchdown on a quarterback sneak. CJ GUNTHER / EPA Halloween arrived a week early in Foxboro. Matthew J. Lee / The Boston Globe Brady yells at a ref. Charles Krupa / AP Jets running back Chris Ivory scores a touchdown to put the Jets ahead 17-16 in the third quarter. Charles Krupa / AP In his first game of the 2015 season, wide receiver Brandon LaFell had six drops in the game. Darren McCollester / Getty Images Brady reacts to not converting a third down. Matthew J. Lee / The Boston Globe Fitzpatrick scrambles out of the pocket. Greg M. Cooper / USA Today Another dropped pass. The Patriots had 11 in the game. Darren McCollester Jets head coach Todd Bowles looks on. Steven Senne / AP Gronkowski runs with the ball in the fourth quarter. Matthew J. Lee / The Boston Globe Wide receiver Danny Amendola put the Patriots up 23-20 with a eight-yard touchdown catch midway through the fourth quarter. Charles Krupa Julian Edelman tries to avoid being tackled by two Jets defenders. Greg M. Cooper Gronkowski puts the Patriots up 30-20 late on a tight end screen pass. Charles Krupa Patriots win 30-23. Matthew J. Lee
